comments:
Created an attachment (id=77717)
Our error log

We prepare a plugin using PDE (GEF+EMF. This plugin requires external jars (other projects of us) containing in lib directory. This jar dependencies written to the MANIFEST.MF file. When we export our plugin no errors occurs. Then we move the plugin to the {eclipse.directory}/plugins we cannot use plugin. 
Ourplugin prepares a UI for user. When we want to instantiate a sample for plugin :
 The selected wizard couldnt be started error is shown.

Any ideas??

Thanks ibrahim


In error log this error:
 An error occurred while automatically activating bundle tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor (308).

tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor.HTNEditorPlugin

Looks like it can't find your class or something it depends on. What's the build.properties, .classpah and Manifest.MF look like for your plugin?

Alex.

MANIFEST.MF:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.core.runtime,org.eclipse.draw2d,org.eclips
 e.equinox.common,org.eclipse.equinox.registry,org.eclipse.gef,org.ecl
 ipse.jface,org.eclipse.osgi,org.eclipse.ui,org.eclipse.ui.ide,org.ecl
 ipse.ui.views,org.eclipse.core.resources,org.eclipse.emf.codegen,org.
 eclipse.emf.common,org.eclipse.jdt.ui,org.eclipse.jdt.core,org.junit4
 ,org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.tabbed,org.eclipse.jface.text
Bundle-Vendor: Seagent Agent Platform
Eclipse-LazyStart: true
Bundle-ClassPath: lib/ant-1.6.4.jar,lib/stax-api-1.0.jar,
 lib/Sekma-20070723s.jar,lib/xercesImpl-2.7.1.jar,lib/concurrent-1.3.2.jar,
 lib/jena-2.4.jar,lib/SeagentLogger-20070803s.jar,lib/antlr-2.7.5.jar,lib/SeagentDomain-20070827s.jar,
 lib/icu4j-3.4.4.jar,lib/SeagentPlanner-20070904s.jar,
 lib/ARQ-0.0.1.jar,lib/SeagentUtil-20070827s.jar,lib/jdepend-2.9.1.jar
Bundle-Version: 1.0.0.v20070726
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Bundle-Name: Seagent HTN Editor
Bundle-Activator: tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor.HTNEditorPlugin
Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
Bundle-SymbolicName: tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor;singleton:=true

build.properties : 

source.. = src/,\
           test/
output.. = bin/
bin.includes = META-INF/,\
               .,\
               shapes.gif,\
               plugin.xml,\
               build.properties,\
               lib/ARQ-0.0.1.jar,\
               lib/SeagentDomain-20070827s.jar,\
               lib/SeagentLogger-20070803s.jar,\
               lib/SeagentPlanner-20070904s.jar,\
               lib/SeagentUtil-20070827s.jar,\
               lib/Sekma-20070723s.jar,\
               lib/ant-1.6.4.jar,\
               lib/antlr-2.7.5.jar,\
               lib/xercesImpl-2.7.1.jar,\
               lib/xml-apis-1.3.02.jar,\
               lib/stax-api-1.0.jar,\
               lib/jena-2.4.jar,\
               lib/jdepend-2.9.1.jar,\
               lib/icu4j-3.4.4.jar,\
               lib/concurrent-1.3.2.jar,\
               .classpath,\
               .project,\
               .settings/
src.includes = bin/
jars.compile.order = .

Classpath : 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<classpath>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="src"/>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="test"/>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER"/>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.pde.core.requiredPlugins">
		<accessrules>
			<accessrule kind="accessible" pattern="org/eclipse/gef/internal/**"/>
			<accessrule kind="accessible" pattern="org/eclipse/jdt/internal/ui/dialogs/**"/>
			<accessrule kind="accessible" pattern="org/eclipse/jdt/internal/ui/wizards/**"/>
			<accessrule kind="accessible" pattern="org/eclipse/jdt/internal/ui/refactoring/contentassist/**"/>
			<accessrule kind="accessible" pattern="org/eclipse/jdt/internal/ui/**"/>
			<accessrule kind="accessible" pattern="org/eclipse/jdt/internal/corext/refactoring/**"/>
		</accessrules>
	</classpathentry>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.maven.ide.eclipse.MAVEN2_CLASSPATH_CONTAINER"/>
	<classpathentry kind="output" path="bin"/>
</classpath>


Plugin cannot find activator class. But in plugin folder that class is exists. Whats the problem here??


(In reply to comment #1)
> > Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
> tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor.HTNEditorPlugin
> 
> Looks like it can't find your class or something it depends on. What's the
> build.properties, .classpah and Manifest.MF look like for your plugin?
> 
> Alex.
>

You're missing '.' on the bundle classpath. It should read:

Bundle-ClassPath: .,lib/ant-1.6.4.jar,lib/stax-api-1-0.jar,..

By the way, it's usually better practice to have dependencies on plugins rather than Jars internally to the app, especially since ant and icu4j are already part of the Eclipse install. But that's not relevant to the problem you are having.

This bug should be closed INVALID, because it's not a bug in Eclipse, but rather a missing entry on the Bundle's classpath.
As Alex mentions, changing your bundle classpath header should fix your problem.

traces.message: The activator tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor.HTNEditorPlugin for bundle tr.edu.ege.seagent.htneditor is invalid
